ground_truth: He falters for a moment, then his smile returns. Lydia and Kitty are enjoying a card game with the officers. Mr. Wickham, now resplendent in his red uniform, watches them with amusement before sitting down next to Lizzie. He leans forward in his seat. They smile at Lydia's celebrations. Lizzie looks thoughtful. Her eyes meet Mr. Wickham's and they smile at each other warmly. She watches him dance with Lydia and smiles to herself. A bedroom. She lowers her eyes coyly. Jane looks unsure. He giggles. A look between Lizzie and Jane. Lydia and Kitty are being pushed on a swing by two uniformed officers. Mr. Collins reluctantly follows Jane, leaving Wickham and Lizzie alone. They stroll through the garden together. She turns to him. They watch as Kitty jumps from the swing into the arms of an officer. Then, they set off walking again. Lizzie smiles contentedly to herself. Now, Mrs. Bennet rushes into Lizzie's room, where a maid is seeing to her hair. Lizzie pops out her cheeks. She runs out of the room. Mr. Collins is leaving his room. He's shocked to bump into the half-dressed Lydia. He tries to pass her, but the landing is too small. He covers his eyes and walks hurriedly past the giggling Lydia. Knowing the laughter is at him, he regains his composure before heading down the stairs. Night time at Netherfield Hall. A constant stream of carriages drop guests at the doors. Mr. Collins helps Lizzie and Jane down from their carriage. As they make their way up a flight of steps, Lizzie spots Darcy looking out of a window. He catches her eye, then turns away. The family makes its way inside, where their cloaks are taken by footmen in wigs. Jane and Lizzie look around the room excitedly before being received by the Bingleys. Lizzie steps away from her family and looks around the room searchingly. Mr. Bingley standing with Jane calls over to her. He offers her his arm, then leads them both through to the next room. Musicians are playing at one end of a large wooden-floored room. Mr. Bingley escorts the sisters proudly through the gathered guests, nodding greetings to uniformed officers and finely attired ladies. Lizzie looks around the other guests while Jane and Bingley chatter happily together. A hopeful smile plays across her lips when she spots a group of red-coated officers gathered in a corner. Darcy is standing a little behind the group. He turns his head, and he and Lizzie catch each other's eye for a moment before she hastily looks away. He continues looking at her. A beautiful smile crosses her face, when Denny breaks away from the others and joins her.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He hesitates briefly, his expression faltering, before his smile blossoms once more. Lydia and Kitty are engaged in a lively card game with the officers, their laughter and competitive spirit evident. Mr. Wickham, adorned in his impressive red uniform, watches them with evident amusement, a gentle smile playing on his lips as he observes the scene. After a moment of observation, he gracefully takes a seat beside Lizzie, leaning forward slightly in his chair to better engage with the unfolding entertainment. Their smiles mirror Lydia's exuberant celebrations, and in this shared joy, Lizzie's expression grows thoughtful. Her eyes meet Mr. Wickham's, and they exchange a warm, mutual smile, a silent conversation passing between them. Lizzie watches fondly as Mr. Wickham takes to the dance floor with Lydia, a private smile gracing her face as she witnesses their lively movements. In a quiet bedroom, her demeanor turns shy, her eyes lowering in a coy manner. Nearby, Jane appears uncertain, her expression reflecting her inner conflict. His laughter fills the space, a look exchanged between Lizzie and Jane, acknowledging the shared moment. Outside, Lydia and Kitty enjoy being pushed on a swing by two officers in uniform, their delighted squeals filling the air. Mr. Collins, with reluctance, follows Jane, leaving Lizzie and Wickham to their own company. Together, they amble through the well-manicured garden, the tranquility of nature enveloping them. Lizzie turns to him, her attention momentarily caught, as they witness Kitty's daring leap from the swing, landing safely in the arms of an officer. With the scene unfolding before them, they resume their leisurely walk, Lizzie's smile one of contentment. Suddenly, the tranquility is disrupted by Mrs. Bennet's hurried entrance into Lizzie's room, where a maid attentively tends to her hair. Lizzie playfully inflates her cheeks before darting out of the room with purpose. Meanwhile, Mr. Collins exits his quarters, unexpectedly encountering the partially dressed Lydia. As he attempts to navigate past her, the narrow landing complicates his efforts, compelling him to shield his eyes as he swiftly moves past her, her laughter trailing behind him. Realizing the laughter is directed at his expense, he steadies himself, regaining his composure before descending the stairs. As night falls at Netherfield Hall, a continuous parade of carriages deposits guests at the grand entrance. Mr. Collins courteously assists Lizzie and Jane alight from their carriage, ensuring their safe step onto the ground. As they ascend the stone steps, Lizzie's attention is drawn to Darcy, who watches from a window above. Their eyes meet, but he quickly averts his gaze. Inside, the family is relieved of their cloaks by efficient footmen donning powdered wigs. Jane and Lizzie's eyes sparkle with excitement as they take in the grandeur of the room, soon joining Mr. Bingley and his sister in a warm welcome. Lizzie gently extricates herself from the family cluster, casting her gaze around the bustling room in search of familiar faces. Mr. Bingley, standing with Jane, jovially calls out to her, offering his arm in a gentlemanly gesture, and leads the sisters into the adjacent chamber. In the expansive room, musicians play elegantly at one end, their melodies resonating off the polished wooden floors. Mr. Bingley, with pride, escorts the sisters through the congregation of guests, nodding amiably to uniformed officers and finely dressed ladies alike. Lizzie's observant eyes scan the assembled guests while Jane and Bingley converse animatedly, their shared joy infectious. A hopeful smile graces Lizzie's lips as she spots a cluster of red-coated officers huddled in a corner, a familiar figure in their midst. Darcy stands slightly apart from the group, catching Lizzie's eye for a fleeting moment before she shyly diverts her gaze. Yet, he continues to watch her, his gaze lingering as a radiant smile blooms on her face, just as Denny steps away from the group, joining her side.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He falters for a moment, then his smile returns, a gesture reminiscent of someone regaining confidence after an unexpected revelation. Lydia and Kitty are enjoying a card game with the officers, young gentlemen from the local militia stationed in Meryton, bringing excitement to the usually quiet town. Mr. Wickham, now resplendent in his red uniform which signifies his rank as a lieutenant, watches them with amusement before sitting down next to Lizzie. He leans forward in his seat, an action suggesting he's eager to engage in a closer conversation. They smile at Lydia's celebrations, her exuberant nature often lighting up the room. Lizzie looks thoughtful, perhaps pondering the complexities of social interactions. Her eyes meet Mr. Wickham's and they smile at each other warmly, sharing a silent understanding based on their brief yet insightful acquaintance. She watches him dance with Lydia and smiles to herself, recalling the charm he effortlessly exudes. A bedroom in the Bennet household, a modest but cozy space filled with personal knick-knacks. She lowers her eyes coyly, a mannerism reflecting the societal norms of modesty and reservation. Jane looks unsure, her gentle nature sometimes leading to moments of hesitancy. He giggles, a light-hearted response to break any lingering tension. A look between Lizzie and Jane communicates a sisterly bond beyond words. Lydia and Kitty are being pushed on a swing by two uniformed officers, their laughter echoing the carefree moments of youth. Mr. Collins reluctantly follows Jane, leaving Wickham and Lizzie alone in the garden, a private enclave filled with blooming roses. They stroll through the garden together, the sweet scent of flowers enveloping them. She turns to him, curiosity about his intentions piqued. They watch as Kitty jumps from the swing into the arms of an officer, a daring display of trust and fearlessness. Then, they set off walking again, their conversation flowing easily. Lizzie smiles contentedly to herself, a rare moment of pure happiness. Now, Mrs. Bennet rushes into Lizzie's room, where a maid is seeing to her hair, meticulously preparing it for the evening's festivities. Lizzie pops out her cheeks, a playful gesture to enliven the preparations. She runs out of the room, her excitement palpable. Mr. Collins is leaving his room, the guest chamber he's been occupying during his stay. He's shocked to bump into the half-dressed Lydia, her brazen confidence catching him off guard. He tries to pass her, but the landing is too small, a design flaw of the compact cottage style of the Bennet home. He covers his eyes and walks hurriedly past the giggling Lydia, her laughter echoing down the narrow stairwell. Knowing the laughter is at him, he regains his composure before heading down the stairs to the drawing room. Night time at Netherfield Hall, the grand estate of the Bingley family, which is a hub of social activity in the neighborhood. A constant stream of carriages drop guests at the doors, the sound of horse hooves muffled by the gravel drive. Mr. Collins helps Lizzie and Jane down from their carriage, ever the gentleman despite his often awkward demeanor. As they make their way up a flight of steps, Lizzie spots Darcy looking out of a window, a solitary figure observing the lively scene below. He catches her eye, then turns away, maintaining his usual aloof demeanor. The family makes its way inside, where their cloaks are taken by footmen in wigs, a testament to the opulence of the gathering. Jane and Lizzie look around the room excitedly, the opulent decorations a treat for their senses, before being received by the Bingleys, whose welcoming manner sets guests at ease. Lizzie steps away from her family and looks around the room searchingly, her keen eye seeking familiar or intriguing faces. Mr. Bingley standing with Jane calls over to her, his jovial nature endearing him to the sisters. He offers her his arm, then leads them both through to the next room, the sound of music growing louder. Musicians are playing at one end of the large wooden-floored room, their harmonies providing the perfect backdrop to the evening's dances. Mr. Bingley escorts the sisters proudly through the gathered guests, nodding greetings to uniformed officers and finely attired ladies, a nod to each signifying the importance of social connections. Lizzie looks around the other guests while Jane and Bingley chatter happily together, their conversation filled with light-hearted banter. A hopeful smile plays across her lips when she spots a group of red-coated officers gathered in a corner, their camaraderie evident. Darcy is standing a little behind the group, his demeanor as reserved as ever. He turns his head, and he and Lizzie catch each other's eye for a moment, an unspoken history passing between them, before she hastily looks away. He continues looking at her, his interest unmistakable. A beautiful smile crosses her face, when Denny, one of the more amiable officers, breaks away from the others and joins her, his easy manner a sharp contrast to the gravity often exuded by Darcy.

Jane looks unsure. He giggles. A look between Lizzie and Jane. Lydia and Kitty are being pushed on a swing by two uniformed officers. Mr Collins reluctantly follows Jane leaving Wickham and Lizzie alone. They stroll through the garden together. She turns to him. They watch as Kitty jumps from the swing into the arms of an officer. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Mr Collins is leaving his room. He is shocked to bump into the halfdressed Lydia. He tries to pass her but the landing is too small. He covers his eyes and walks hurriedly past the giggling Lydia. Knowing the laughter is at him he regains his composure before heading down the stairs. Night time at Netherfield Hall. A constant stream of carriages drop guests at the doors. Mr Collins helps Lizzie and Jane down from their carriage. As they make their way up a flight of steps Lizzie spots Darcy looking out of a window. He catches her eye then turns away. The family makes its way inside where their cloaks are taken by footmen in wigs. Jane and Lizzie look around the room excitedly before being received by the Bingleys. Lizzie steps away from her family and looks around the room searchingly. Mr Bingley standing with Jane calls over to her. He offers her his arm then leads them both through to the next room. Musicians are playing at one end of a large woodenfloored room. Mr Bingley escorts the sisters proudly through the gathered guests nodding greetings to uniformed officers and finely attired ladies. Lizzie looks around the other guests while Jane and Bingley chatter happily together. A hopeful smile plays across her lips when she spots a group of redcoated officers gathered in a corner. Darcy is standing a little behind the group. He turns his head and he and Lizzie catch each other's eye for a moment before she hastily looks away. He continues looking at her. A beautiful smile crosses her face when Denny breaks away from the others and joins her.

The river looks thoughtful. Its eyes meet the mountain's and they smile at each other warmly. The river watches it dance with the cloud and smiles to itself. A bedroom. The river lowers its eyes coyly. The sun looks unsure. The rock giggles. A look between the river and the sun. A cloud and a tree are being pushed on a swing by two uniformed officers. The clock reluctantly follows the sun, leaving the mountain and the river alone. They stroll through the garden together. The river turns to it. They watch as the tree jumps from the swing into the arms of an officer. Then, they set off walking again. The river smiles contentedly to itself. Now, a cat rushes into the river's room, where a lamp is seeing to its hair. The river pops out its cheeks. The lamp runs out of the room. The clock is leaving its room. It's shocked to bump into the half-dressed cloud. It tries to pass the cloud, but the landing is too small. The clock covers its eyes and walks hurriedly past the giggling cloud. Knowing the laughter is at it, the clock regains its composure before heading down the stairs. Night time at a Castle. A constant stream of carriages drop guests at the doors. The clock helps the river and the sun down from their carriage. As they make their way up a flight of steps, the river spots a fox looking out of a window. It catches the river's eye, then turns away. An orchestra makes its way inside, where their cloaks are taken by footmen in wigs. The sun and the river look around the room excitedly before being received by the Bingleys. The river steps away from its orchestra and looks around the room searchingly. The statue escorts the siblings proudly through the gathered guests, nodding greetings to uniformed officers and finely attired ladies. The river looks around the other guests while the sun and the statue chatter happily together. A hopeful smile plays across its lips when it spots a group of red-coated officers gathered in a corner. A fox is standing a little behind the group. It turns its head, and it and the river catch each other's eye for a moment before it hastily looks away. The fox continues looking at the river. A beautiful smile crosses the river's face, when a leaf breaks away from the others and joins it.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He hesitates for a moment, then his grin broadens. Lydia and Kitty are observing a card game with the officers. Mr. Wickham, now splendid in his red uniform, studies them with curiosity before stretching out next to Lizzie. He reclines back in his seat. They chuckle at Lydia's antics. Lizzie seems contemplative. Her eyes connect with Mr. Wickham's and they exchange warm glances. She notices him twirling with Lydia and chuckles softly. A bedroom. She raises her eyes coyly. Jane appears uncertain. He chuckles. An exchange between Lizzie and Jane. Lydia and Kitty are being swung on a swing by two uniformed officers. Mr. Collins grudgingly trails Jane, leaving Wickham and Lizzie together. They meander through the garden side by side. She glances toward him. They observe as Kitty leaps from the swing into the embrace of an officer. Then, they commence strolling again. Lizzie grins contentedly to herself. Now, Mrs. Bennet dashes into Lizzie's room, where a maid is attending to her hair. Lizzie puffs out her cheeks. She darts out of the room. Mr. Collins is exiting his room. He's startled to encounter the half-dressed Lydia. He attempts to sidestep her, but the landing is too cramped. He shields his eyes and scurries past the giggling Lydia. Knowing the laughter is directed at him, he collects himself before descending the stairs. Nighttime at Netherfield Hall. A steady stream of carriages deposits guests at the entrance. Mr. Collins assists Lizzie and Jane out of their carriage. As they proceed up a flight of steps, Lizzie notices Darcy peering out from a window. He notices her gaze, then averts his eyes. The family proceeds inside, where their cloaks are collected by footmen in wigs. Jane and Lizzie survey the room eagerly before being welcomed by the Bingleys. Lizzie separates from her family and surveys the room inquisitively. Mr. Bingley standing with Jane beckons to her. He extends his arm to her, then guides them both into the adjacent room. Musicians are performing at one end of a large wooden-floored room. Mr. Bingley navigates the sisters proudly through the assembled guests, nodding acknowledgments to uniformed officers and elegantly dressed ladies. Lizzie scans the other guests while Jane and Bingley converse cheerfully together. A hopeful grin graces her lips when she notices a group of red-coated officers gathered in a corner. Darcy is positioned a little behind the group. He shifts his gaze, and he and Lizzie make brief eye contact before she quickly glances away. He continues observing her. A radiant smile illuminates her face, when Denny disengages from the others and approaches her.

test_cases.description: He stumbles for a moment, then his grin returns. Naomi and Bella are enjoying a card game with the gardeners. Her eyes meet Mr. Thompson's and they chuckle at each other warmly. She observes him paint with Naomi and grins to herself. A living room. She averts her eyes coyly. Emma looks uncertain. He snickers. A glance between Clara and Emma. Naomi and Bella are being twirled on a merry-go-round by two uniformed gardeners. They watch as Bella leaps from the merry-go-round into the embrace of a gardener. Then, they set off strolling again. Clara grins contentedly to herself. He's startled to encounter the half-dressed Naomi. He attempts to navigate past her, but the corridor is too narrow. He shields his eyes and scurries hurriedly past the giggling Naomi. Knowing the mirth is directed at him, he regains his dignity before proceeding down the stairs. Nighttime at Pemberley Manor. A continuous stream of vehicles drops visitors at the front. Clara moves away from her group and surveys the room inquisitively. Mr. Parish standing with Emma gestures to her. He presents her his arm, then guides them both through to the adjacent room. A radiant grin spreads across her face when Alden detaches from the others and joins her.

Darcy stands slightly apart behind the group. He turns his head, and he and Lizzie catch each other's gaze for a brief moment before she quickly averts her gaze. He continues watching her. A stunning grin spreads over her face when Denny detaches from the others and approaches her.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The rabbit hesitates briefly, then its grin reappears. Olga and Tina are savoring a chess match with the bakers. Mr. Turnip, now dazzling in his green jumpsuit, observes them with delight before perching beside Hattie. He tilts backward in his chair. They grin at Olga's enthusiasm. Hattie appears pensive. Her gaze meets Mr. Turnip's and they beam at each other warmly. She observes him juggle with Olga and grins to herself. A kitchen. She raises her gaze bashfully. Lisa seems uncertain. He chuckles. A glance between Hattie and Lisa. Olga and Tina are being twirled on a carousel by two suit-clad bakers. Mr. Crumbs hesitantly tails Lisa, leaving Turnip and Hattie isolated. They amble through the library together. She glances towards him. They watch as Tina leaps from the carousel into the arms of a baker. Then, they resume meandering. Hattie grins serenely to herself. Now, Mrs. Hopper dashes into Hattie's office, where a janitor is attending to her shoes. Hattie puffs out her cheeks. She dashes out of the office. Mr. Crumbs is exiting his office. He's startled to collide with the half-dressed Olga. He attempts to bypass her, but the corridor is too narrow. He shields his face and scurries hurriedly past the chuckling Olga. Realizing the laughter is aimed at him, he regains his poise before proceeding down the elevator. Evening at Blueberry Mansion. A continuous parade of bicycles drops travelers at the entrance. Mr. Crumbs assists Hattie and Lisa down from their bicycle. As they proceed up a set of ladders, Hattie notices Victor peering from a curtain. He meets her gaze, then turns aside. The clan makes its way indoors, where their scarves are gathered by porters in turbans. Lisa and Hattie survey the space eagerly before being welcomed by the Applebys. Hattie drifts away from her clan and surveys the space inquisitively. Mr. Appleby standing with Lisa calls over to her. He extends his elbow, then guides them both through to the adjacent space. Magicians are performing at one end of a vast marble-tiled space. Mr. Appleby leads the siblings proudly through the assembled travelers, nodding acknowledgments to suit-clad bakers and elegantly dressed gentlemen. Hattie glances at the other travelers while Lisa and Appleby converse joyously together. An optimistic grin dances across her lips when she notices a band of green-jumpsuit bakers clustered in a corner. Victor is positioned slightly behind the band. He rotates his head, and he and Hattie meet each other's gaze for a moment before she quickly averts her eyes. He continues observing her. A radiant grin spreads across her face, when Benny detaches from the crowd and approaches her.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: He falters briefly, then smiles again. Lydia and Kitty play cards with officers as Mr. Wickham, in his red uniform, watches amusedly before sitting beside Lizzie. They exchange warm smiles. Lizzie observes him dancing with Lydia, smiling to herself. In a bedroom, Jane looks unsure, while Lizzie and Jane share a knowing look. Lydia and Kitty swing with officers before Lizzie and Wickham stroll in the garden, as Lizzie smiles contentedly. Mrs. Bennet rushes into Lizzie's room, interrupting as a maid tends to her hair. Lizzie quickly leaves. Mr. Collins, surprised by a half-dressed Lydia, awkwardly passes her, regaining composure amid her giggles. At night, carriages arrive at Netherfield Hall. Mr. Collins aids Lizzie and Jane from their carriage. Lizzie spots Darcy in a window; he turns away. Inside, cloaks are taken by footmen, and Jane and Lizzie are greeted by the Bingleys. Lizzie steps away, searching the room. Mr. Bingley escorts Jane and Lizzie, greeting officers and ladies. Lizzie hopes when she spots red-coated officers and catches Darcy’s eye momentarily before looking away. She smiles beautifully as Denny joins her.
